description: Modifies the original Settings class provided by the user

port.description: Port to expose the server on the specified host
port.title: Port

auto_reload.description: A development feature. Set to `True` to automatically reload the server upon code changes
auto_reload.title: Auto Reload

workers.description: Number of workers processes to run.
workers.title: Workers

api_root_path.description: Root path at which the API is reachable. This is relative to the specified host and port.
api_root_path.title: Api Root Path

openapi_url.description: Path to get the openapi specification in JSON format. This is relative to the specified host and port.
openapi_url.title: Openapi Url

docs_url.description: Path to host the swagger documentation. This is relative to the specified host and port.
docs_url.title: Docs Url

cors_allowed_origins.description: A list of origins that should be permitted to make cross-origin requests. By default, cross-origin requests are not allowed. You can use ['*'] to allow any origin.
cors_allowed_origins.title: Cors Allowed Origins

cors_allow_credentials.description: Indicate that cookies should be supported for cross-origin requests. Defaults to False. Also, cors_allowed_origins cannot be set to ['*'] for credentials to be allowed. The origins must be explicitly specified.
cors_allow_credentials.title: Cors Allow Credentials

cors_allowed_methods.description: A list of HTTP methods that should be allowed for cross-origin requests. Defaults to ['GET']. You can use ['*'] to allow all standard methods.
cors_allowed_methods.title: Cors Allowed Methods

cors_allowed_headers.description: A list of HTTP request headers that should be supported for cross-origin requests. Defaults to []. You can use ['*'] to allow all request headers. The Accept, Accept-Language, Content-Language, Content-Type and some are always allowed for CORS requests.
cors_allowed_headers.title: Cors Allowed Headers

cors_exposed_headers.description: A list of HTTP response headers that should be exposed for cross-origin responses. Defaults to []. Note that you can NOT use ['*'] to expose all response headers. The Cache-Control, Content-Language, Content-Length, Content-Type, Expires, Last-Modified and Pragma headers are always exposed for CORS responses.
cors_exposed_headers.title: Cors Exposed Headers

generate_correlation_id.description: A flag, which, if False, will result in an error when inbound requests don't possess a correlation ID. If True, requests without a correlation ID will be assigned a newly generated ID in the correlation ID middleware function.
generate_correlation_id.title: Generate Correlation Id

service_name.description: A service to teach about services
service_name.title: Service Name

title: ModSettings
